From: "S. Alexander Jacobson" <alex@...>

> see if anyone has added anything new since
> the last time I checked the folder.
If 'checking' is both safe and idempotent, you will have to explicitly mark
messages as being viewed/processed/whatever.
You could do this many ways - send a 'mark all inbox items', send a list of
items to mark, assign URIs to each item & mark each inbox item, etc..

> Any thoughts on how to solve this without forcing
> the client to GET the entire folder each time?
If you mark items as being processed, this can move them to a separate
collection - the 'viewed' list or the 'deleted' list or whatever.
Then when you check for new messages, the 'inbox' list will be empty when
there are no new messages.
You will always need to check periodically, but the response can be empty
which cuts down on data transfer.

I think this is similar to the 'model a message queue with HTTP' discussion
of a few months ago....
